title: 105_hr2949
content: The Missouri and Middle Mississippi Rivers Enhancement Project is outlined in Section 1. The Middle Mississippi River and Missouri River Enhancement Project involves developing a plan to protect and enhance fish and wildlife habitat in the specified river reaches. The project is authorized by the Secretary of the Army. The Secretary will develop a plan for a project to protect and enhance fish and wildlife habitat of the Missouri River and middle Mississippi River, ensuring activities do not adversely affect water-related needs or private property rights. This includes modifying navigation training structures. The plan for the project includes modification and improvement of navigation training structures, creation of side channels, restoration of island habitat, creation of riverine habitat, and establishment of criteria for prioritizing activities based on cost-effectiveness and success likelihood. The plan for the project includes modification and improvement of navigation training structures, creation of side channels, restoration of island habitat, creation of riverine habitat, establishment of criteria for prioritizing activities based on cost-effectiveness and success likelihood, and physical and biological monitoring for evaluating project success. Implementation of activities involves carrying out the plan using available funds and utilizing existing authority for unconstructed project features. The Secretary will design and construct project features to accelerate activities for fish and wildlife habitat protection, integrating them with other Federal and State activities. This does not affect existing project authority. The Secretary will design and construct project features to accelerate activities for fish and wildlife habitat protection, integrating them with other Federal and State activities. This section does not confer any new regulatory authority on any Federal or non- Federal entities. The Secretary will provide public participation and comply with applicable laws in developing and carrying out the plan for fish and wildlife habitat protection. No new regulatory authority is conferred by this section. The Secretary will comply with applicable laws, including the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969, in developing and carrying out the plan for fish and wildlife habitat protection. The non-Federal share of project costs shall not exceed 25%, with a Federal share limit of $5,000,000 per activity. Operation and maintenance of the project will be a Federal responsibility. $50,000,000 is authorized for appropriations for activities under this section from 1999 to 2004. Authorization of Appropriations: $50,000,000 is authorized for the Federal share of project costs from 1999 to 2004. Funds will be managed by the Mississippi Valley Division of the Army Corps of Engineers and distributed to appropriate Districts. Maintenance of the project is a Federal responsibility.
